1.text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, And attend to know understanding.

2.text: For I give you good doctrine; Forsake ye not my teaching.

3.text: For I was a son unto my father, Tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.

4.text: And he taught me, and said unto me: ‘Let thy heart hold fast my words, Keep my commandments, and live;

5.text: Get wisdom, get understanding; Forget not, neither decline from the words of my mouth;

6.text: Forsake her not, and she will preserve thee; Love her, and she will keep thee.

7.text: The beginning of wisdom is: Get wisdom; Yea, with all thy getting get understanding.

8.text: Extol her, and she will exalt thee; She will bring thee to honour, when thou dost embrace her.

9.text: She will give to thy head a chaplet of grace; A crown of glory will she bestow on thee.’

10.text: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings; And the years of thy life shall be many.

11.text: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in paths of uprightness.

12.text: When thou goest, thy step shall not be straitened; And if thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

13.text: Take fast hold of instruction, let her not go; Keep her, for she is thy life.

14.text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, And walk not in the way of evil men.

15.text: Avoid it, pass not by it; Turn from it, and pass on.

16.text: For they sleep not, except they have done evil; And their sleep is taken away, unless they cause some to fall.

17.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, And drink the wine of violence.

18.text: But the path of the righteous is as the light of dawn, That shineth more and more unto the perfect day.

19.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness; They know not at what they stumble.

20.text: My son, attend to my words; Incline thine ear unto my sayings.

21.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; Keep them in the midst of thy heart.

22.text: For they are life unto those that find them, And health to all their flesh.

23.text: Above all that thou guardest keep thy heart; For out of it are the issues of life.

24.text: Put away from thee a froward mouth, And perverse lips put far from thee.

25.text: Let thine eyes look right on, And let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.text: Make plain the path of thy feet, And let all thy ways be established.

27.text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; Remove thy foot from evil.
